results.title: Color speaks
results.creator_credit: Agoshdang Karyani and Hungarian Documentary Film Studios
results.brief_description: The beauties of the landscape, its colorful plant life and the insects and animals which inhabit it: laws of nature and the part color plays in them. Good close up and time lapse photography of insects, plants, birds and animals.

results.title: Color and light: an introduction
results.brief_description: Demonstrates characteristics of colour formation by different kinds of light. Uses theatrical spotlights to show the effect of various kinds of light with opaque, transparent, and translucent objects.

results.title: Colonialism: ogre or angel?
results.creator_credit: Ronald Dick and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”.
How the British colonial empire grew is a story as full of adventure as it is of contrast. This film takes us to British colonies, protectorates and protected states to see the impact of industrialization on colonial people, and their awakening desire for self-determination. Narrated by Edgar McInnis.

results.title: Colonial expansion of European Nations
results.brief_description: Explains how mercantilism influenced the colonial expansion of European nations in the 16th and 17th centuries. Traces the overseas expansion of Portugal, Spain, England, France and Holland. Discusses the different factors which caused Europeans to leave their homes to settle in North America and in other foreign lands.

results.title: Colloids
results.creator_credit: Piers Jessop and Cammell Hudson Productions
results.brief_description: An explanation of the behaviour of particles suspended in a medium of which commonplace examples are milk, clouds and stained glass. Describes the factors involved in colloid formation. Discusses the importance of colloid chemistry to industry, the understanding of which is an essential part of today’s technology.

results.title: Colloids
results.brief_description: A description of the properties of colloidal suspensions, concentrating on the means of preventing coagulation by attraction between particles. Examples are taken from everyday occurrence including the activity of detergents on oils.

results.title: Cocoa harvest
results.brief_description: The film shows the method of harvesting cocoa in the Gold Coast region of West Africa, including scenes of village life, sacks of beans on their way to the depot for grading and weighing, and finally transport by train and truck to the coast to be loaded on to ocean going steamers for export.
results.description: The film shows the method of harvesting cocoa in the Gold Coast region of West Africa, including scenes of village life, sacks of beans on their way to the depot for grading and weighing, and finally transport by train and truck to the coast to be loaded on to ocean going steamers for export.

results.title: Cockpit drill
results.brief_description: Racing driver David Mackay discusses good driving drill: comfortable position, rear vision, and exact knowledge of “controls” (lights, wipers, choke, etc). Observe the road laws, always allowing for changing weather and traffic conditions. Exercise care when parking - turn off ignition, brake securely, and lock the car.

results.title: Clerical work
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
This is a field of work with many opportunities: secretaries, optometrists, general clerks, receptionists, bank teller, enquiry clerk, accountant and section head. Shows that with machines performing the monotonous jobs, todays office work is concerned more with planning and people. Part of the “Is this your career?”series.
